intro: Astracantha marashica, commonly known as the Marash bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
